sen.j: 掲子内親王（ながこないしんのう、生年不詳 - 延喜14年2月23日 (旧暦)（914年3月22日））は、平安時代前期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Princess Nagako (the year of birth unknown-March 22, 914) was a member of Imperial family in the early Heian period.
Imperial Princess Nagako (the year of birth unknown-March 22, 914) was a member of the Imperial family during the early Heian period.
Imperial Princess Nagako (year of birth unknown - March 27, 914) was a member of the Imperial Family during the early Heian period.
sen.cmt: 用語統一グレゴリオ暦に変更

sen.e: Ise Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of Emperor Yozei.
Ise Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of Emperor Yozei.
Ise Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine) of Emperor Yozei.

sen.j: 名は揚子内親王あるいは楊子内親王とも表記する。
sen.e: The name "掲子内親王" is also represented "揚子内親王" or "楊子内親王."
The name "掲子内親王" is also represented "揚子内親王" or "楊子内親王."
The name "掲子内親王" is also represented "揚子内親王" or "楊子内親王."
the seventh princess of Emperor Montoku
the seventh princess of Emperor Montoku
The seventh princess of Emperor Montoku
younger half sister of Emperor Seiwa
younger half sister of Emperor Seiwa
Younger half sister of Emperor Seiwa
muhon (without a court rank)
muhon (without a court rank)
Muhon (without a court rank)

sen.j: 彼女の生母については定説がなく、更衣 (女官)紀静子とする説（『帝王編年記』）、後宮藤原今子とする説（『本朝皇胤紹運録』）などがある。
sen.e: There are several views about her real mother such as that the mother was koi (nyokan, a lady waiting in the court) by "Teio Hennenki (the Chronicle of emperors)" or a kokyu (consort of the emperor) FUJIWARA no Konshi by "Honcho Koinjounroku (the Emperor's family tree, made in Muromachi period)," therefore there is no generally accepted view about it.

There are several views about her real mother such as the mother was koi (nyokan, a lady waiting in the court) by "Teio Hennenki (the Chronicle of emperors)" or a kokyu (consort of the emperor) FUJIWARA no Konshi by "Honcho Koinjounroku (the Emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period)," therefore there is no generally accepted view.

There are several views about her real mother such as the mother was koi (nyokan, a lady waiting in the court) by "Teio Hennenki" (the Chronicle of emperors) or a kokyu (consort of the emperor) FUJIWARA no Konshi by "Honcho Koinjounroku" (the Emperor's family tree, made in the Muromachi period), therefore there is no generally accepted view.

sen.j: 元慶6年（882年）4月、清和上皇の崩御を受けて退下した識子内親王（清和天皇皇女）と交替して伊勢斎宮に卜定される。
sen.e: In April, 882, she was decided as Ise Saigu by fortunetelling in place of Imperial Princess Satoko (a princess of Emperor Seiwa) who resigned from Ise Saigu on the demise of Emperor Seiwa.
In April, 882, she was decided as Ise Saigu by fortunetelling to replace Imperial Princess Satoko (the princess of Emperor Seiwa) who resigned from Ise Saigu upon the demise of Emperor Seiwa.
In April, 882, she was decided as Ise Saigu by fortunetelling to replace Imperial Princess Satoko (the princess of Emperor Seiwa) who resigned from Ise Saigu upon the demise of Emperor Seiwa.

sen.j: 翌年の元慶7年（883年）に野宮に入るが、群行しないうちに元慶8年（884年）陽成天皇の退位により退下した。
sen.e: In 883, the next year, she entered Nonomiya (Field Palace for imperial princesses to purify themselves), but before gunko (to go into Ise Shrine after the period of the purification), she resigned from Ise Saigu because of the Emperor Yozei's abdication from the emperor's throne.

In 883, the next year, she entered Nonomiya (Field Palace for imperial princesses to purify themselves), but before gunko (to go into Ise Shrine after the period of the purification), she resigned from Ise Saigu because of the Emperor Yozei's abdication from the throne.

In 883, the next year, she entered Nonomiya (Field Palace for imperial princesses to purify themselves), but before gunko (to go into Ise Shrine after the period of the purification), she resigned from Ise Saigu because of the Emperor Yozei's abdication from the throne in 884.
On February 23, 914 she passed away.
On February 23, 914 she passed away.
On March 27, 914 she passed away.
